Behold with ardent Love, and pious care,</br>The tender mother cast her eyes around;</br>Delighted with her prattling offspring fair,</br>Where Field for sage instruction does abound</br>And much, I ween, she thinks of planting there,</br>Chaste virtue's favorite field — meet for such fruitage rare.

Kisses to One she gives with melting glee</br>While to her throbbing heart another's prest</br>One little impe she places on her knee</br>Upon her foot another takes his rest</br>Eftsoons her eyn the circling train survey,</br>To mark how Love and truth, in sweet assemblage play.

The lisping word, the supplicating eye,</br>Full plain their various needment do declare</br>She kens their actions with a conscious joy</br>And when she strives with kind maternal Care</br>With smiles to cherish, or with frowns reprove</br>Tis aye with good Intent, tis aye with tenderest Love.

So views our heav'nly parent on high</br>His frail creation with indulgent care</br>So does his hand each real want supply</br>Whether he grant, or he reject our pray'r</br>And, since each action well he can areed,</br>Certes, he once will grant to every Wight his need.</br>
